principles: Gamify Everything: Every interaction should feel like a game mechanic.
Pop & Punch: Use high saturation colors and thick borders.
Motion is Meaning: Things don't just appear; they bounce, slide, and pop.
Data is Art: Charts shouldn't be boring; they should look like power levels.

instructions_to_main_agent: INSTALL FONTS: Add '@fontsource/outfit' and '@fontsource/fredoka' to package.json and import in index.js.
TAILWIND CONFIG: Update tailwind.config.js to include the new colors and extend the border radius/box shadow theme.

SHADCN OVERRIDE: You must override the default Shadcn styles. Do not use the subtle gray borders. Use the 'border-2 border-black' and 'shadow-[4px_4px_0px_0px_rgba(0,0,0,1)]' classes defined in visual_enhancers.
LAYOUT: Use the Bento Grid strategy for the dashboard. Mix large summary cards with smaller stat cards.
CHARTS: Use Recharts. Style them to match the category colors (e.g., Study chart = Blue, Gym chart = Red).
GAMIFICATION: Add a 'Level' progress bar at the top of the dashboard. It should be big and chunky.
TESTING: Add data-testid to all interactive elements (buttons, inputs, cards).
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: You tend to converge toward generic, 'on distribution' outputs. In frontend design, this creates what users call the 'AI slop' aesthetic. Avoid this: make creative, distinctive frontends that surprise and delight.
Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
